content: What element with atomic number 79 is also referred to as Aurum in Latin?

The element with atomic number 79 is gold, which is known as Aurum in Latin. Gold has been highly valued by many cultures throughout history due to its rarity, attractiveness, and malleability. It has been used for jewelry, currency, and various other purposes. In addition to its cultural significance, gold also has several industrial and scientific applications, including in electronics, dentistry, and aerospace engineering.
